org.usfirst.frc.team1072.harkerrobolib.util

Class PIDSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team1072.harkerrobolib.util.PIDSystem

  • public class PIDSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    A PID Feedback Loop System. This should be integrated with a PIDSystemCommand for continuous feedback. This should not be confused with the WPILibJ PIDController as that has been historically proven to have issues in implementation.
    Author:
    Manan Shah, atierno

        name - The name of the system.
        p - The proportional gain.
        i - The integral gain.
        d - The derivative gain.
        minSaturation - The minimum output of the integral term for error calculation.
        maxSaturation - The maximum output of the integral term for error calculation.
        See Also:
        updatePID(double, double)

    • Method Detail

      • updatePID

        public void updatePID(double currError,
                      double timeStep)
        This function updates the feedback loop given the current error and the time since the last call. It should be called frequently on a regular basis to make sure that the outputs are current. Ideally this should be used with a PIDSystemCommand. The essential idea is that it takes the current error term from the ideal output (i.e. the difference between the velocity of the drivetrain and the target velocity). It then calculates the integral error (the sum of all errors over the lifetime of the system), the current error (passed as a parameter, the error relative to the current output) and the difference error (the difference between the current and past error). These errors are summed into the new output, control. Control should be used directly for whatever output source is being utilized. If doesApplySaturation is set to true, the PIDSystem will also check to see if the integral error has grown beyond what is possible for the output or if it has gotten too noisy (i.e. returning a number greater than 1 or less than -1 for an analog motor which has a range of -1.0 to 1.0).
        Parameters:
        currError - The current error from the ideal target
        timeStep - The time since the last call of the function
